{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Paul-Bunnell test is commonly used to diagnose infectious mononucleosis. It is based on the detection of heterophile antibodies in the patient's serum. The test works by agglutination of sheep or horse red blood cells (SRBCs or HRBCs) in the presence of the patient's serum.
